intro: Ochrosia alyxioides, commonly known as the silver-leafed orchid, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which are usually pale yellow to orange, bloom in late winter to early spring. Ochrosia alyxioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in tropical gardens.
